intro: Tecoma tronadora, commonly known as the thunder tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Tecoma tronadora thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
